alert.note: Alert for Cabell; Mason; Wayne (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 1:28PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Boyd, central Meigs, Gallia, southeastern Jackson, Lawrence, northwestern Mason, central Cabell and northern Wayne Counties through 200 PM EDT... At 126 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Rio Grande to near Kenova. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Huntington, Ashland, Ironton, Point Pleasant, Gallipolis, Coal Grove, Pomeroy, Rio Grande, Chesapeake, Proctorville, Rutland, Cannonsburg, Barboursville, Kenova, Catlettsburg, New Haven, Ceredo, Mason, South Point and Waterloo. This includes the following highways... Interstate 64 in Kentucky between mile markers 184 and 191. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 1 and 22. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
